articles.author: OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ and STEFANIE DAZIO
articles.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Hundreds of Northern California residents have been ordered to evacuate from their homes in an Oakland neighborhood as a fast-moving fire grew along a hillside Friday afternoon, a fire official said.
articles.title: Hundreds ordered to evacuate from fast-moving Northern California fire, official says

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN, JOEY CAPPELLETTI and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (AP) — Kamala Harris and Donald Trump both sought support from Arab American voters Friday as they campaigned in Michigan, trying to lock down support in a battleground state that could decide the presidential race next month.
articles.title: Harris and Trump seek Arab American votes in Michigan in effort to shore up battleground states

articles.author: GARY D. ROBERTSON
articles.description: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) — More North Carolina residents turned out to cast ballots on the first day of early voting this year than in 2020, even as residents from the mountainous western portion of the state continued to recover from the devastating effects of Hurricane Helene.
articles.title: North Carolina early voters, still recovering from Helene, exceed 2020 voter turnout

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hamas confirmed Friday that its leader, Yahya Sinwar, was killed by Israeli forces in Gaza and reiterated its stance that hostages the militant group took from Israel a year ago will not be released until there is a cease-fire in Gaza and a withdrawal of Israeli troops.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas signal resistance to ending Gaza war after Sinwar's death

articles.author: ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — The killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar by Israeli forces in Gaza this week leaves the Palestinian militant group considering new leadership for the second time in less than three months.
articles.title: What's next for Hamas after its leader Yahya Sinwar's death?

articles.author: STAN CHOE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. stocks closed their latest winning week with more records on Friday.The S&P 500 rose 0.4% to squeak past the all-time high it had set early this week.
articles.title: Stock market today: Wall Street sets more records and closes a 6th straight winning week

articles.author: OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ and STEFANIE DAZIO
articles.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Hundreds of Northern California residents have been ordered to evacuate from their homes in an Oakland neighborhood as a fast-moving fire grew along a hillside Friday afternoon, a fire official said.
articles.title: Hundreds ordered to evacuate from fast-moving Northern California fire, official says

articles.author: ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ
articles.description: HAVANA (AP) — Cuba’s electrical grid went offline Friday after one of the island’s major power plants failed, and as a massive blackout that started a day earlier swept across the Caribbean island.
articles.title: Cuba’s grid goes offline amid a massive blackout and after a major power plant fails

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: This year has seen President Vladimir Putin repeatedly brandish the nuclear sword, reminding everyone that Russia has the world’s largest atomic arsenal to try to deter the West from ramping up support for Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia flaunts its many doomsday weapons to keep the West from ramping up support for Ukraine

articles.author: ISABELLA VOLMERT and MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: Christian nationalist leaders are telling followers that Vice President Kamala Harris is under the influence of a “Jezebel spirit,” using a term with deeply racist and misogynistic roots that is setting off alarm bells for religious and political scholars.
articles.title: What's a 'Jezebel spirit'? Some Christians use the term to paint Kamala Harris with a demonic brush
